publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-265 Richard Lochhead: Location of Meetings of the Parliament—That the Parliament recognises that taking its activities outwith Edinburgh and Glasgow on a regular basis would send a positive signal to the whole of Scotland and calls upon the Scottish Parliamentary Corporate Body and the Parliamentary Bureau to identify a suitable location in the north east of Scotland to host meetings of the Parliament in the event that a temporary home is required.

S1M-265 Richard Lochhead: Location of Meetings of the Parliament-That the Parliament recognises that taking its activities outwith Edinburgh and Glasgow on a regular basis would send a positive signal to the whole of Scotland and calls upon the Scottish Parliamentary Corporate Body and the Parliamentary Bureau to identify a suitable location in the north east of Scotland to host meetings of the Parliament in the event that a temporary home is required.
S1M-265 Location of Meetings of the Parliament (lodged on 9 November 1999) Andrew Wilson*

S1M-265 Richard Lochhead: Location of Meetings of the Parliament—That the Parliament recognises that taking its activities outwith Edinburgh and Glasgow on a regular basis would send a positive signal to the whole of Scotland and calls upon the Scottish Parliamentary Corporate Body and the Parliamentary Bureau to identify a suitable location in the north east of Scotland to host meetings of the Parliament in the event that a temporary home is required. Supported by: Andrew Wilson, Tricia Marwick*
S1M-265 Location of Meetings of the Parliament (lodged on 9 November 1999) Mr Kenny MacAskill*
S1M-265 Location of Meetings of the Parliament (lodged on 9 November 1999) Irene McGugan*

S1M-265 Richard Lochhead: Location of Meetings of the Parliament—That the Parliament recognises that taking its activities outwith Edinburgh and Glasgow on a regular basis would send a positive signal to the whole of Scotland and calls upon the Scottish Parliamentary Corporate Body and the Parliamentary Bureau to identify a suitable location in the north east of Scotland to host meetings of the Parliament in the event that a temporary home is required. Supported by: Andrew Wilson, Tricia Marwick, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Irene McGugan
S1M-265 Location of Meetings of the Parliament (lodged on 9 November 1999) Shona Robison*
S1M-265 Location of Meetings of the Parliament (lodged on 9 November 1999) Michael Matheson*

S1M-265 Richard Lochhead: Location of Meetings of the Parliament—That the Parliament recognises that taking its activities outwith Edinburgh and Glasgow on a regular basis would send a positive signal to the whole of Scotland and calls upon the Scottish Parliamentary Corporate Body and the Parliamentary Bureau to identify a suitable location in the north east of Scotland to host meetings of the Parliament in the event that a temporary home is required. Supported by: Andrew Wilson, Tricia Marwick, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Irene McGugan, Shona Robison, Michael Matheson
S1M-265 Location of Meetings of the Parliament (lodged on 9 November 1999) Brian Adam*

S1M-265 Richard Lochhead: Location of Meetings of the Parliament—That the Parliament recognises that taking its activities outwith Edinburgh and Glasgow on a regular basis would send a positive signal to the whole of Scotland and calls upon the Scottish Parliamentary Corporate Body and the Parliamentary Bureau to identify a suitable location in the north east of Scotland to host meetings of the Parliament in the event that a temporary home is required. Supported by: Andrew Wilson, Tricia Marwick, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Irene McGugan, Shona Robison, Michael Matheson, Brian Adam, Kate Maclean*

S1M-265 Richard Lochhead: Location of Meetings of the Parliament—That the Parliament recognises that taking its activities outwith Edinburgh and Glasgow on a regular basis would send a positive signal to the whole of Scotland and calls upon the Scottish Parliamentary Corporate Body and the Parliamentary Bureau to identify a suitable location in the north east of Scotland to host meetings of the Parliament in the event that a temporary home is required. Supported by: Andrew Wilson, Tricia Marwick, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Irene McGugan, Shona Robison, Michael Matheson, Brian Adam, Kate Maclean

S1M-265 Richard Lochhead: Location of Meetings of the Parliament—That the Parliament recognises that taking its activities outwith Edinburgh and Glasgow on a regular basis would send a positive signal to the whole of Scotland and calls upon the Scottish Parliamentary Corporate Body and the Parliamentary Bureau to identify a suitable location in the north east of Scotland to host meetings of the Parliament in the event that a temporary home is required. Supported by: Andrew Wilson, Tricia Marwick, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Irene McGugan, Shona Robison, Michael Matheson, Brian Adam, Kate Maclean
S1M-265 Location of Meetings of the Parliament (lodged on 9 November 1999) Mr Adam Ingram*, Mr Gil Paterson*

S1M-265 Richard Lochhead: Location of Meetings of the Parliament—That the Parliament recognises that taking its activities outwith Edinburgh and Glasgow on a regular basis would send a positive signal to the whole of Scotland and calls upon the Scottish Parliamentary Corporate Body and the Parliamentary Bureau to identify a suitable location in the north east of Scotland to host meetings of the Parliament in the event that a temporary home is required. Supported by: Andrew Wilson, Tricia Marwick, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Irene McGugan, Shona Robison, Michael Matheson, Brian Adam, Kate Maclean, Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Gil Paterson
